attributes.Ambience: {'romantic': False, 'intimate': False, 'touristy': False, 'hipster': False, 'divey': False, 'classy': False, 'trendy': False, 'upscale': False, 'casual': True}
attributes.GoodForMeal: {u'breakfast': False, u'brunch': False, u'lunch': True, u'dinner': None, u'latenight': True, u'dessert': False}

text: Pizza place on a college campus. They are used to doing high volume. Over the years, I've gotten the tomato pie and regular pizza. They make a party size one, which is a monster size. They also have take out beers and such. It's a nice addition for a pizza joint.

if you're black or if you're white n care about black people i'd avoid this place. a black woman in front of me in line was ignored and the person serving tried to literally go around her to serve me. also they kicked a black man out who was simply waiting for his order and chatting w another customer. the owner came over and told him to stop disrespecting folks and the people who he was talking to literally said he's not disrespecting them but the owner kicked him out anyhow

This is definitely the quickest pizza order. Great quality. Delivery is fast and they even sell fruit cups and other goodies inside. Please don't overlook them for the bad reviews. I've had an excellent experience. Very consistent.

Food safety seems to be a big problem for them. Ordered a Sicilian pizza only to have it delivered raw an hour later. Called back, and they said they'd send a new one, which showed up burnt on the edges, and raw in the middle, again. We tried to see if we could revive it in our own oven, but no luck. For $25, it was pretty disappointing. The other food we ordered was sub par, and we all ended up sick from it. Avoid at all costs.

I was trying to support a small business, but don't waste your time ordering pizza. I asked for vegetarian slice and a extra cheese slice. This is the foolery I received. I could've slapped Kraft cheese and peppers on my own pizza instead of paying for this to be delivered.

Really awful service at this restaurant. I have been coming here a while but had another bad experience. 

I ordered a burger last week around 10:30 pm. Cashier said it would be 5 minutes or so. After 10 minutes, I asked someone else and they said it would be 7-10 minutes. I did not receive my food until 11:15 and when I had gotten home the burger was dry and the bun was *burnt*. I guess those 40 minutes were just spent grilling a patty into a tough sponge. 

Don't come here unless you being drunk and eating bad food and/or wasting your money.
Garbage food and no regard for Covid. At least the service is horrible! This place is the pits.

Absolutely not following COV19 guidelines. Beware! I just left  this poorly managed establishment and one cashier and one guy making pizza had on mask. Only after several students came in did the manager/owner put on a mask. One guy in the back cooking had no mask on a girl sweeping the floor had no mask on. No one took control of the overcrowded waiting area as one guy came in with his T shirt pulled up. So student cause the employees to wear mask not regular folks?!?!

My go to place to pick up something quick and delicious (pizza and cheesesteaks) on my way home from work! Pepperoni pizza is always a hit with my family. My favorite is white w/ garlic, spinach and grilled chicken.
Food was  completely saturated in ranch from my "side salad" ... maybe package separately next tim

Just got off the phone with a "manager" who was incredibly rude about a delivery order I placed over 2 hours ago. The order never showed up, although we called 30 minutes ago and was told it was "on the way" The manager explained that there was a mistake in the restaurant and the Grubhub order was never rung in the system and that they will cancel the order. When I asked if I would be compensated for their mess up, and told him we were still hungry and waiting for our food, he told me there is nothing he can do and they don't give out free food. I told him they are losing a customer and he didn't seem to care! Will never order from them again.

This place has great pizza! If you're looking for something quick and cheap, then this is the place. Compared to the surrounding pizza joints, I prefer Allegros. They also have unique toppings that live up to my expectations. Although it gets super busy on the weekends, it is very clean inside. The times I've been there, there is staff constantly wiping down the tables.
I'm not sure if this is under new ownership but it's totally disorganized. I ordered ahead 30 minutes and they weren't ready 45 minutes later. I'll be finding a new local pizzeria

I probably won't be ordering from allegro again. I got it delivered through grub hub and they forgot my drink, the pizza was dry and cardboardy, the Mac and cheese is literally just penne and cheez wiz, and there was no mayo on my cheesesteak even tho I asked for it. The soup was ok though.

Only giving Allegro's 2stars for the simple fact they stopped delivering pass 49th street in Southwest which is corny cause they use to back in like up to '12. Guess because it's rougher down towards this end they loss their heart to come pass 49th street. When they started that they even use to put you on hold and ask in the background "do we deliver there"? Come back and say "No".

  It's cool though cause I drive anywhere If the food is worth it but them they fell off anyway over the years rushing and trying to appeal to the University of Penn students. So I mean it is what it is but quality wise over the most recent years, they still ain't that great either and I know cause I use to order pickup like I said they lost their touch.

I don't always find myself up in West Philly, but when I do I always end up at Allegro! They're open late night and even open at 11 AM with a full selection of regular and gourmet pizza. This place has a decent beer selection and a wide variety of pizzas. I am always happy when I walk out and I always know where to go next time I am in West Philly.

Avoid this place.  The pineapple on the hawaiian pizza had obviously gone bad, and the people working here are not very bright.  Messed up order and tried to blame on the customer.  Also doesn't look like a very organized or clean kitchen.

It's an average pizza place. I used to get food from here a lot when I worked night shift. Their hours are very convenient.since switching to day shift I haven't order from here as often due to other options. They sell more than just pizza. Their delivery tends to arrive in good timing. If I ever go back to night shift I could see myself ordering from here more.
I guess this is a pretty average pizza spot, they have what you'd expect and some other random things. decent selection of beer too
Pretty good food. We ordered delivery and got Mac and cheese, motz sticks, pizza, and a turkey panini. Everything was pretty good, and the kids really liked the Mac and cheese.

I gave them four stars because this establishment is very transparent in what you get: a college student centered, late night pizza. The cheese pizza was pretty good, a little undercooked, but again this place serves its purpose. Cheap and pretty good.

With three stars, it might seem like this will be a bad review, but I actually love and regularly order Allegro pizza - it's just important to have the right expectations going in. Allegro is good for "college pizza" - late night, not-much-else-is-open, dependable kind of pizza. I usually get a large cheese, and every single time have had to re-cook it in my oven at home because the dough is still soft. Once re-cooked, it's great! They're really generous with the cheese, and the crust is thin without being insubstantial. So if you want some solid late-night pizza, and don't mind the extra 10 min of recooking, Allegro is a good choice.

Allegro pizza!!! This is definitely the place to go if you want shitty pizza and shitty service. They have the worst pizza and service ever. Please save your money and go somewhere else. They are not worthy of my one star that I have to give on my review.

Oh Allegro. I've had it so many times that at this point, I can recognize the smell of it from anywhere. The pizza itself is so oily that you can use 1-2 napkins to wipe it off beforehand. It looks and tastes like it was designed for drunk college students to munch on after a long night. Don't come here if you don't have a good reason to.

Ordered delivery for two pizzas and a side of mozzarella sticks. One large 16 inch bbq pizza and one regular 14 inch veg pizza. Received a wrong sized pie. Called the restaurant immediately to see if they could correct the mistake. Gentleman by the name of Valentino claimed to be the manager for "5yrs without a problem"  cursed me out and hung up on me after I asked him for his name repeatedly and if he could correct the mistake. Contacted grubhub's customer care service and I was told by Grubhub the restaurant would not send the correct item and that at the moment they were not able to refund me at that I would be contacted by via email. My order was 59dollars. They took my money, got my order wrong, refused to correct their mistake, cursed at me, and hung up on me. I will be pursuing my refund. Allegro's you can expect to hear from in the immediate future.

Lots of reviews saying this is a good drunk-pizza place. No - it's much better than that. We order delivery from here a couple of times a month and the stromboli is EPIC. So good. And their salads are luscious, fresh and generously-portioned. Delivery from this place is a go-to for us...we recommend!

...allegro just lost a long time, steady customer.   over the last several months, they've screwed up my order almost every time.   this last time, they added the extra bonus of blaming me for the screw up.   about a week ago, i ordered a large extra cheese pizza and a 20 oz. coke, the pizza came to me with 1/3 of the cheese slid off of the pizza and congealed in the corner of the box, and they forgot my coke.   when i called to complain, the young lady on the phone told me; "this happens sometimes when the pizza is hot"   ...uh, what???   ...seriously???   ...that's the "explanation" you're going with?   ...anyway, she offered to credit me for my next order, which i accepted.   last night, i ordered a pizza and a sprite, when i asked if they had my credit on file, the man on the phone said; "yes, i see a credit for $10", which was odd, because my previous order total was $20 and change, the man's reply was "i don't know what to tell you, buddy, i can only see what is on the computer"   ...unwilling to argue over $10, i placed the order ...2 hours later, i called an asked if my order was coming any time soon, he told me "we tried to deliver, but you never answer your phone, we call many times", which was a lie, my phone was sitting in front of me on the coffee table the entire time (after he said that, i even had my GF test call me just to be sure my ringer was on) ...the man on the phone became argumentative with me, insisting it was my fault my order did'nt get delivered, i cut him off and just asked them to bring my food ...another 40 minutes later, the driver shows up with the cold pizza, and a diet dr. pepper (i asked for a sprite)   ...this is merely the most recent of screw ups, but i kept giving them chances because i've been going there since i was a teen, they do have decent food, they're close to the house, and up until recent years, the customer service has been good ...but i am done with allegro, they will get no more of my money.

By far the most mediocre pizza I've ever had. If you are on campus and perhaps drunk, then it's a great spot. Optimal drunk food. However, if you're sober, prepare for a usually long line, and a super mediocre, slightly stale slice of pizza.
Dough tastes like chlorine. Yelp wants me to write more or else I can't post this, but really this is all I had to say.

Allegro was a pretty good place for a cheesesteak. I mean, it wasn't as great as the secret cheesesteaks on other menus from pizza joints around the Philly area, but it is better than the tourist traps. It is definitely a hangout for cops in the area and students wanting a slice of pizza or sandwich. They have a good beer selection too. Make sure you ask for the fried onions on your cheesesteak or you won't get them.

I have enjoyed their food for years working overnights in University City, especially because of how late they deliver (3:30 AM on Friday and Saturday), their location, and that I'm not able to leave the building until 7:00 AM. Saturday morning around 3:00 AM, I place an online order. Confirmation e-mail estimates delivery around 3:34 AM. I wait another 15-20 minutes past that to call because I am busy helping clients. I call twice to confirm my order and the phone rings several times before it hangs up. No one called to say they were on their way or that they could or could not fulfill my order, so now my card's charged and I received no food. If their hours changed in general or because of the holidays, they should have reached out to me. I had to wait to call them the following morning to get refunded. They were apologetic and handled it, but it was disappointing considering I did enjoy their service and menu previously.

21.00 for a pie. 

I asked for extra cheese and sauce. And got extra veggies with very little cheese and sauce. Didn't eat the pie. I'm taken this shit back soon as they open.

Mad as hell!!

Was amazed this place is still open, and this is probably the only pizzeria in the area that is like the ones you find in New York, noticed now they have a large drink refrigerator. Its ok but its not the best.

I got the Cheesesteak.  I was pretty much the only person eating a cheesesteak.  I quickly found out why.  150 beers, the pizza smelled amazing and the cheesesteak was average at best.  If I go back it will be for a pizza and beer special.

Went in there today and got a couple of slices and some drinks. The guy running the register, Dan was cashing out a customer who didn't speak a lot of English. The customer bought a bottle of water and Dan proceeded to ask 3 times for $1.89. After the third time he demanded the customer put the money in his hand and not on the counter and caught a major attitude with the customer, saying it was disrespectful not to hand the money to him. Then proceeded to take another customer in front of us because we were looking at him like he was crazy. When we asked for the manager, she didn't seem to care either. If you are going to get upset over every perceived disrespect, maybe customer service is not your thing.

This is the classic drunk pizza place and for what it's worth, it's pretty decent. I'd give it 3.5 stars if I could; I've had better cheap pizza, but for a restaurant that opens very late at night it is pretty decent.

The pizza itself is alright - it's your average, run of the mill pizza. It's good for a late night snack. The dough is nice; whenever I eat here, I find the crust isn't as hard as some other thin pizza slices and I find myself eating the crust. 

I haven't tried anything outside of the pizza, but I think I'll only be coming back when it's very late at night.

Pizza quality has gone down hill seriously, the toppings only covered the middle area and the cheese was put on very sparingly. Most of the pizza was just crust. Too bad, they use to be good but I guess they need to pay for their fancy beer pub next door so cutting corners is the new norm. Owner used to be friendly but now he's just cocky. This is so typical for the areas restauranteers, too much money to be made in this town.

Allegro's have the WORST customer service I have ever experienced. I placed large catering order a week and advance, explained that the food needed to be delivered by 10:30 am and needed to be dropped of at a specific location. The food showed up 45 minutes later, I never received a phone call, and it was WRONG! I had to carry the food up to the event myself, because the deliver driver supposedly couldn't get past security, which was a complete lie. Though, he was somehow able to get through security to carry up two of the items. He even had my phone number if there was an issue and I never received a call. When I called and spoke to the "supposed" manager Dan he was extremely rude and sarcastic. I can't even tell you if the food was good, because the order was wrong and we didn't have enough food, so I didn't get to try it. My advise to the owner of Allegro...get rid of those miserable people you have working for you.

My friend and I ordered Allegro Pizza after seeing Justin Timberlake in concert. My semi-drunk friend said, "I am kinda drunk and this pizza still tastes like shit. It's disgusting." We specifically ordered ranch; did not get it. 

A complete waste of $30. If you love yourself or even care about yourself at all, don't order food from here. Go to bed hungry instead.
Lol if you want to wait an hour for wings then I guess you've found the right place or for them to tell you they didn't have any cheese for cheese fries

Such a disappointment! I ordered a chicken parm without pasta and they somehow interpreted it as a chicken parm sandwich. When I asked them to fix it they handed me a box to go and when I opened it i realized they had just given me the inside of the chicken parm sandwich and had only taken it out of the bread! Are you kidding?? Dry chicken and sad display. If they messed up, they should have fixed it CORRECTLY. I'm disappointed and still hungry.

Wow, were to start. Was overcharged as a failure to recognize their own special, order did not contain all the requested ingredients, and had to wait longer than suggested. Overall, terrible. Take your money elsewhere if you can.

I ordered MILD WINGS for the superbowl with a side of blue cheese and ranch. I receive BUFFALO WINGS and break out in hives from the spices of wings. I am always aware of wings before ordering due to SEVERE ALLERGIES TO A CERTAIN AMOUNT OF SPICE. These wings were literally drown in sauce. I called back and they were suppose to deliver my sauce. 35 minutes later, still no sauce on the way (delivery man was "on his way") ; still I wait ONE HOUR AND 15 MINUTES WAITING FOR A NEW SET OF WINGS THE MANAGER PROMISED ME. Horrible Customer Service from the Manager and Still No Phone Call or a Refund in my account. I am very disappointed that I didnt call New Style from the first place. never AGAIN!  
(I LIVE 2 BLOCKS AWAY and AM A CHEF! )

While this is my local pizza shop and the food is usually pretty good, I would recommend eating in rather than delivery or pick-up. The portions are better in-store, the food is fresh and hot, and the service is notably better. Ordering pick up or delivery, I've had several scenarios where they don't deliver my order, miss a few items, and take more time than people who just walk in and order.

One of my go-to food places. Their food is great, staff is friendly, and the restaurant is always clean, even the bathroom. 

They have almost anything you can think of, from pizza to pasta to hoagies to burgers. I can't say they have the absolute best tasting pizza, but everything else is usually pretty good. They even carry coolers! 

I love that they're 24/7 as well! They're in a really decent place in University City. Delivery is usually on time, correct, & food still hot. We order so much that they know us by now! Haha. I, honestly can't think of anything bad to say as I've rarely had negative experiences with Allegro.

Cheap pizzeria place, HOWEVER, it is decent/very good for the price they charge.

Good sizes and nice taste. Good place to go when you are starving and have no money. 

- Do not expect a fancy place. 
- I would recommend getting the food and then leaving

NEVER AGAIN. Delivery driver never called tonight, just texted. NEVER ONCE CALLED. Then stood there for 7 minutes, still never calling. Until he finally decided to pound on my window so violently I thought a neighbor's house was on fire. I had zero appetite after your 9:30pm Friday delivery guy literally scared it out of me. Also, my coleslaw looked and tasted a lot like potato salad.

I actually really enjoy their pizza here, it reminds me of the dollar pizzas I used to get growing up in New York. So I dare say it tastes like New York pizza. I like a good thin floppy crust with extra cheese, but that's my preference.

Very crowded between 12-2 AM, usually full of drunk people but a slice of pizza is $3-4 which is quite overpriced in my opinion. The slices are decently large, but I would probs say it's more worth $2 or $2.50 instead. In terms of what to get, their Allegro's is good (mozzarella, spinach and cheese), their chicken bacon ranch is pretty good too :)

We ordered pizza here based on a recommendation for a friend. We made the mistake of doing delivery. The pizza when it arrived was nearly cold...not even warm. The order was correct at least. Also, the pizza (2 toppings on each side) with delivery & 20% tip ended up being almost $28 for 1 large pizza. All that said, if the pizza were a bit more affordable and I picked it up myself, I would venture to say it would be a pretty good pizza. There are too many options in the neighborhood to try it again though.
